com.samsung.android.sdk.mediacontrol

Interface SmcAvPlayer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    SmcDevice

    public interface SmcAvPlayer
extends SmcDevice
    This interface provides methods to stream audio and video and to control the audio video player.

    See Also:
    SmcDevice

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  SmcAvPlayer.EventListener
      This listener interface provides callback methods for player events.
      static interface  SmcAvPlayer.MediaInfo
      This interface provides methods for getting duration information on the currently playing media.
      static class  SmcAvPlayer.PlayInfo
      This class contains a position in a media clip from the beginning of the clip.
      static interface  SmcAvPlayer.ResponseListener
      This listener instance provides callback methods for playback response events.

    • Field Summary

      Player state is unknown.

      • Fields inherited from interface com.samsung.android.sdk.mediacontrol.SmcDevice

        DOMAIN_LOCAL_NETWORK, DOMAIN_MY_DEVICE, DOMAIN_REMOTE_NETWORK, DOMAIN_UNKNOWN, TYPE_AVPLAYER, TYPE_IMAGEVIEWER, TYPE_PROVIDER, TYPE_UNKNOWN

    • Field Detail

      • STATE_STOPPED

        static final int STATE_STOPPED
        Player is stopped.

        You can indicate that the content has stopped playing in your application. You can invoke the play() method in this state, but you cannot invoke the resume(), pause(), or seek() methods.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_BUFFERING

        static final int STATE_BUFFERING
        Player is buffering.

        You can indicate that the media player is currently loading the content in your application. You cannot play any content in this state.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_PLAYING

        static final int STATE_PLAYING
        Player is playing.

        You can indicate that the content is playing in your application. You can invoke the pause(), seek(), and stop() methods in this state.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_PAUSED

        static final int STATE_PAUSED
        Player is paused.

        You can indicate that the content is paused in your application. When you call the resume() method, the content resumes from the last played position. You cannot invoke any other player methods.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_CONTENT_CHANGED

        static final int STATE_CONTENT_CHANGED
        Player content has changed.

        Other content has arrived in the player and the content you were playing is no longer in the player. Reinitialize your content by calling the play(SmcItem, SmcAvPlayer.PlayInfo) method again to play the original content.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_UNKNOWN

        static final int STATE_UNKNOWN
        Player state is unknown.

        You can ignore this state for player GUI.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • play

        void play(SmcItem smcItem,
        SmcAvPlayer.PlayInfo contentInfo)
        Play the specified audio or video content from the specified starting point.

        The response for this method is returned asynchronously using SmcAvPlayer.ResponseListener.onPlay(SmcAvPlayer, SmcItem, com.samsung.android.sdk.mediacontrol.SmcAvPlayer.PlayInfo, int).

        Parameters:
        smcItem - The audio or video content that you want to play.
        contentInfo - Starting position in the audio/video clip that you want to play.

      • prepare

        void prepare(SmcItem smcItem)
        Prepare the SmcAvPlayer instance to play the specified content by pre-fetching the content while other content is playing.

        Parameters:
        smcItem - The audio or video content that you want pre-fetched.

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stop playing the SmcAvPlayer instance.

        The response for this method is returned asynchronously using SmcAvPlayer.ResponseListener.onStop(SmcAvPlayer, int).

      • seek

        void seek(long targetTime)
        Change the playing position by the specified time.

        If the content provider does not allow seek operations, this method returns a success code but the playing position is not changed.

        The response for this method is returned asynchronously with SmcAvPlayer.ResponseListener.onSeek(SmcAvPlayer, long, int).

        Parameters:
        targetTime - The time to add to the playing position in seconds. The value of the target time must be greater than 0.

      • pause

        void pause()
        Pause the SmcAvPlayer instance.

        The response for this method is returned asynchronously with SmcAvPlayer.ResponseListener.onPause(SmcAvPlayer, int).

      • resume

        void resume()
        Resume the paused SmcAvPlayer instance.

        The response for this method is returned asynchronously using SmcAvPlayer.ResponseListener.onResume(SmcAvPlayer, int).

      • requestVolumeInfo

        void requestVolumeInfo()
        Get the current volume level.

        The volume value range is 0~100. The response for this method is returned asynchronously using SmcAvPlayer.ResponseListener.onSetVolume(SmcAvPlayer, int, int).

      • setVolume

        void setVolume(int level)
        Set the specified volume level.

        The volume value range is 0~100. The response for this method is returned asynchronously using SmcAvPlayer.ResponseListener.onSetVolume(SmcAvPlayer, int, int).

        Parameters:
        level - The value for the volume level

      • requestMuteInfo

        void requestMuteInfo()
        Get the current mute status.

        The response for this method is returned asynchronously using SmcAvPlayer.ResponseListener.onSetMute(SmcAvPlayer, boolean, int).

      • setMute

        void setMute(boolean onOff)
        Set mute on or off.

        The response for this method is returned asynchronously using SmcAvPlayer.ResponseListener.onSetMute(SmcAvPlayer, boolean, int).

        Parameters:
        onOff - Set to true to switch mute on, set to false to switch mute off.

      • requestPlayPosition

        void requestPlayPosition()
        Get the current playing position in seconds.

        The response for this method is returned asynchronously using SmcAvPlayer.ResponseListener.onRequestPlayPosition(SmcAvPlayer, long, int).

      • requestStateInfo

        void requestStateInfo()
        Get the current state of the SmcAvPlayer instance.

        The response for this method is returned asynchronously using SmcAvPlayer.ResponseListener.onRequestStateInfo(SmcAvPlayer, int, int).

      • requestMediaInfo

        void requestMediaInfo()
        Get duration information on the currently playing media.

        The response for this method is returned asynchronously using SmcAvPlayer.ResponseListener.onRequestMediaInfo(SmcAvPlayer, SmcAvPlayer.MediaInfo, int).

      • isSupportVideo

        boolean isSupportVideo()
        Check if the SmcAvPlayer instance supports video content.

        Returns:
        • true - if the SmcAvPlayer instance supports video content.
        • false - if the SmcAvPlayer instance does not support video content.

      • isSupportAudio

        boolean isSupportAudio()
        Check if the SmcAvPlayer instance supports audio content.

        Returns:
        • true - if the SmcAvPlayer instance supports audio content.
        • false - if the SmcAvPlayer instance does not support audio content.

      • isSupportRedirect

        boolean isSupportRedirect()
        Check if the SmcAvPlayer instance supports the redirect delivery mode.

        For more information about the redirect delivery mode, see Field Detail in the SmcItem.WebContent class.

        Returns:
        • true - if the SmcAvPlayer instance supports redirect delivery.
        • false - if the SmcAvPlayer instance does not support redirect delivery.

      • isSupportDynamicBuffering

        boolean isSupportDynamicBuffering()
        Check if the SmcAvPlayer instance supports dynamic buffering.

        Returns:
        • true - if the SmcAvPlayer instance supports dynamic buffering.
        • false - if the SmcAvPlayer instance does not support dynamic buffering.

      • skipDynamicBuffering

        void skipDynamicBuffering()
        Skip dynamic buffering.

        When you call this method, the SmcAvPlayer instance plays when the player buffer has enough content to play. If the SmcAvPlayer instance does not support dynamic buffering, this method is not valid.

      • setResponseListener

        void setResponseListener(SmcAvPlayer.ResponseListener listener)
        Set the specified ResponseListener instance to receive response events.

        Parameters:
        listener - The SmcAvPlayer.ResponseListener instance for receiving playback response events. Set to null to unregister the current listener.

      • setEventListener

        void setEventListener(SmcAvPlayer.EventListener listener)
        Set the specified EventListener instance to receive player events.

        Parameters:
        listener - The SmcAvPlayer.EventListener instance for receiving player events. Set to null to unregister the current listener.
